Description:
The FHIR Procedure resource defines an activity performed on or with a patient as part of the provision of care. It corresponds with surgeries and procedures performed, including endoscopies and biopsies, as well as less invasive actions like counseling and physiotherapy. Because terminology codes for procedures are often billing related, some procedures might not have a terminology code, especially when billing activities are not performed within Epic.

The Procedure (Surgeries) API is designed to summarize any performed surgical procedures for a patient. Other types of procedures may be returned in other APIs, such as the Procedure (Orders) API for procedures created from orders.

This resource is designed for a high-level summarization around the occurrence of a procedure, and not for specific procedure log documentation - a concept that does not yet have a defined FHIR Resource.

The read interaction enables the lookup of a Procedure resource by a constant server ID. Read interactions begin with a client having previously established a relationship, typically when following a reference to this resource from another resource or through querying for procedures through the search interaction.

{

},

basedOn.Name: basedOn
basedOn.Description: Reference to the ServiceRequest resource that the procedure log was created from.

bodySite.Name: bodySite
bodySite.Description: External code for the Operative Region for the procedure. Laterality for the procedure may be included as a Bodysite-Qualifier extension value to bodySite.

category.Name: category
category.Description: A code that classifies the procedure. This will always be SNOMED code 387713003 (Surgical procedure) for the Procedure (Surgeries) API.

data-absent-reason.Name: extension
data-absent-reason.Description: The reason why normally expected content of the data element is missing. Set to “not-performed” for surgeries without a performed time or period.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: Reference to an Encounter resource associated with the Procedure.

focalDevice.Name: focalDevice
focalDevice.Description: Reference to a device marked as implanted, explanted, or adjusted during the procedure.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: System-specific ID for the procedure order record.

location.Name: location
location.Description: Reference to the location resource where the procedure was performed.

outcome.Name: outcome
outcome.Description: Discharge disposition from the linked ADT contact.

performedDateTime.Name: performedDateTime
performedDateTime.Optional: Either this or performedPeriod will be populated.

performedPeriod.Name: performedPeriod
performedPeriod.Description: Period of time over which the procedure was performed.
performedPeriod.Optional: Either this or performedDateTime will be populated.

actor.Name: actor
actor.Description: Reference to the Practitioner that performed the procedure.

reasonCode.Name: reasonCode
reasonCode.Description: External codes for diagnosis records associated with the procedure.

reasonReference.Name: reasonReference
reasonReference.Description:
Applicable only to organizations in the Netherlands.

Reference to a condition associated with the DBC episode for the procedure.

report.Name: report
report.Description: Reference to the DocumentReference resource that contains notes from the surgical log.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
The status of the Procedure.

API Value FHIR Event Status
cancelled stopped
active in-progress
completed completed
aborted stopped

*Note: Omitted FHIR event status equivalent values are not returned by this search

statusReason.Name: statusReason
statusReason.Description: The reason that a procedure was not performed, which is sent only when the status is Stopped.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Reference to the Patient resource for whom this Procedure resource is relevant.

usedReference.Name: usedReference
usedReference.Description: Reference to a device marked as a wasted implant that was used during the procedure.
